Name: adult-onset autosomal dominant demyelinating leukodystrophy
Definition: A leukodystrophy characterized by onset in the 4th or 5th decade of life of autonomic abnormalities
Synonym: autosomal-dominant or late-onset type Pelizaeus-Merzbacher disease

Name: hypomyelinating leukodystrophy
Definition: A leukodystrophy characterized by T2 hyperintensity and T1 iso- or hyperintensity of affected white matter in the central nervous system.

Name: leukoencephalopathy with vanishing white matter
Definition: A leukodystrophy characterized by variable neurologic features resulting from deficiency in astrocyte maturation

Name: megalencephalic leukoencephalopathy with subcortical cysts
Definition: A leukodystorphy characterized by infantile-onset macrocephaly
Synonym: vacuolating megalencephalic leukoencephalopathy with subcortical cysts

Name: adult-onset leukoencephalopathy with axonal spheroids and pigmented glia
Definition: A leukodystrophy that is characterized by progressive dementia

Name: adrenoleukodystrophy
Definition: A leukodystrophy that disrupts the breakdown of very-long-chain fatty acids resulting in progressive brain damage

Name: CADASIL
Definition: A leukodystrophy characterized by recurrent subcortical ischemic stroke and cognitive impairment.

Name: Canavan disease
Definition: A breast adenocarcinoma in which at least one half of the tumor volume is extracellular mucin throughout.
Synonym: Spongy degeneration of central nervous system

Name: Alexander disease
Definition: A leukodystrophy that is characterized by the destruction of white matter and the formation of Rosenthal fibers consisting of abnormal clumps of protein that accumulate in astrocytes.
